posts.content:
I've gone back through some of my favorite builds here and on the WOG search engine.  As I've tried to replay them, I've noticed several are no longer viable due to the differences between EE and earlier editions.  

The two most frequent issues I see are:

1) The minimum ability level if switching to a caster as a 2nd or 3rd class - e.g. if you're building a Fighter/Ranger, you cannot use Ranger as the 2nd class unless it has a minimum WIS of 11, and

2) XP penalty (for humans) if highest class is Prestige and the other two base classes are not within a level of each other - e.g. FTR 7/PAL 5/WM 28 suffers XP penalty at WM 7 going forward.

Is there any interest in going back and updating some of the old Epic Builds and retooling them for EE?   I'm going to try some, but as others have pointed out, I'm a crappy builder .

TBH, AFAIK the only thing that has changed with EE :
  1. Caster Levels for Dispellability (not counting Mord's) has been increased by 1 level to 25 (used to be 24)
  2. Assassin Death Attack Para has been reduced to the very first attack instead of the first Flurry.
  3. Monk Stunning Palm is now 1 round (instead of 1d4 or so).
  4. Cleric Divine Power attacks have been somewhat nerfed.
  5. Shifter Rakasha Ice Storm can no longer be meta-magiced.

https://nwn.fandom.com/wiki/Multiclass_penalty
"Prestige classes and multiclass XP
Prestige classes are exempt from the multiclass XP rule and do not contribute to the multiclass penalty. For example, a character with one base class and any number of prestige classes (such as a 10th-level rogue/3rd-level shadowdancer/7th-level assassin) will not suffer any XP penalties no matter what race the character is. Similarly, a character with levels in a favored base class and at most one other base class (and possibly levels in a prestige class) will not suffer any XP penalties. However, a character with two non-favored base classes could suffer a -20% penalty; this character will not, though, suffer a -40% penalty, even if the character has levels in a prestige class. A -40% penalty can only occur when a character has three base classes (and only when those classes are not nearly the same level).
In version 1.69, a human or half-elf with a prestige class would never suffer a multiclass penalty, as one of the base classes would always be favored. This is no longer the case in the Enhanced Edition. For example, a human 6th-level fighter/4th-level paladin/7th-level champion of Torm will have two non-favored base classes and one favored prestige class. The non-favored base class levels differ by more than one, so there is a -20% XP penalty."

I actually am the one who first put it on the Wiki.  I was building a PAL9/SOR1/RDD30 for kicks and noticed as I was playing HOTU that he got an XP Penalty at RDD10.

EDIT - apparently, it's been fixed.  Never mind on that part.

WRT some builds I loved (Hammer Knight Empyreal, etc.) that were heavy on Prestige Classes, maybe the universe of people who care is too small to worry about.
